heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (176°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 56.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 42.8°C), feels like temperature (up 45.0°C), outside temperature (up 45.7°C), and cloud levels (up 236 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 495.1m lower than yesterday, 236.1m lower than the past week, 115.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 1184m and a high of 3910m, averaging 1619.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
